column3: > https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/storage_duration#external_linkage\n\nSo basically: never use `extern` for functions, as they have external linkage by default, only for variables? This keeps coming back so it would be good to write it down in the developer notes.

> This keeps coming back so it would be good to write it down in the developer notes.\n\nIt seems all additions date back at least 5 years, so we didn't have any issues with this recently. And it shouldn't cause any harm. It is simply redundant. I'll leave this as if for now, but I am happy to review a pull that adds this to the dev notes.
cr ACK fa4bbd306e1ca369d02eb864983fbb4d64b50ca9: patch looks correct
